bioAsHtml: René Gielen is an independent software craftsman, consultant, trainer, lecturer and author, focused on the Java platform ecosystem, agile methodologies and application lifecycle management. In the last 15 years, he has helped clients ranging from startups to large multinational companies realizing software projects and processes of any scale. He is a frequent speaker at conferences and Java User Groups. Whenever possible, René tries to invest time in his open source activities. He is the project management committee (PMC) chair of the Apache Struts project and a Vice President of The Apache Software Foundation. Besides other open source activities, he is and was active in the design and development of the Apache Struts 2 framework.
bio:
René Gielen is an independent software craftsman, consultant, trainer, lecturer and author, focused on the Java platform ecosystem, agile methodologies and application lifecycle management. In the last 15 years, he has helped clients ranging from startups to large multinational companies realizing software projects and processes of any scale. He is a frequent speaker at conferences and Java User Groups.
Whenever possible, René tries to invest time in his open source activities. He is the project management committee (PMC) chair of the Apache Struts project and a Vice President of The Apache Software Foundation. Besides other open source activities, he is and was active in the  design and development of the Apache Struts 2 framework.
